title: How did New York overtake London as the most prominent city in the 1800s? - Quora

response.answer_text: It didn’t. Because of the scope of the British Empire and it’s political influence, London was the most prominent city in the world at that time. London was on the leading edge of urban development and because of the Empire, it was the political and economic center of the world. It was far wealthier and powerful than NYC. NYC did have a few wealthy citizens and it was the seat of American financial. That said, it had little global influence and was mostly just a port city. It didn’t even become London’s American contemporary until probably the mid 20th century.

In the 1800s? I doubt your facts on that surmise. The City of London was the centre of the largest Empire in history, whilst New York was just getting started. I still doubt that New York has overtaken London in prominence world wide, though it depends on what you mean by prominent?
